net.hudup.core.logistic

Interface Runner

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDelegator, AbstractRunner, Balancer, CounterClock, Delegator, EstimateEvaluator, EvaluatorAbstract, ExecuteEvaluator, Listener, RecommendEvaluator, SocketServer

    public interface Runner
extends java.lang.Runnable
    This interface specifies that any object that implements it can start, pause, resume, and stop by itself. Such object called runner like system thread.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isPaused()
      Testing whether runner paused.
      boolean isRunning()
      Testing whether runner is running.
      boolean isStarted()
      Testing whether runner started.
      void pause()
      Runner pauses.
      void resume()
      Runner resumes after runner pauses.
      void run() 
      void start()
      Runner starts running.
      void stop()
      Runner stops.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        void start()
        Runner starts running. This method will be synchronized.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Runner pauses. This method will be synchronized.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Runner resumes after runner pauses. This method will be synchronized.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Runner stops. If runner wants to run again, runner must start again. This method will be synchronized.

      • isStarted

        boolean isStarted()
        Testing whether runner started.

        whether runner started

        Testing whether runner is running.
        Returns:
        whether runner is running.
